Tartakower follows the original methods of Horatio Caro and Marcus Kann. A popular move today is 4...N-Q2, to be followed up by N(1)-B3 so as to recapture with the QN if White exchanges on KB6.

Offering the Knight as bait.
Tartakower grabs thoughtlessly. 8...B-K2 would have guarded the entry square on Q8 and prepared for K-side castling. Now Reti has a forced mate.
He begins with a Queen sacrifice.
Reti continues with a double check.

Tartakower is doomed either way. If 10...K-K1, Reti plays 11 R-Q8 mate.
Instead, he mates with the Bishop. Fine attacking play.
